intro: Drosanthemopsis bella, commonly known as the velvetleaf gloxinia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to violet. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Drosanthemopsis bella is typically grown as a houseplant due to its sensitivity to cold temperatures.
